steps.title: Make the batter first
steps.step: In a large bowl, whisk together flour, dashi, mirin, baking powder, salt, and sugar. Beat in eggs until smooth.

steps.title: Rest the batter
steps.step: Let it sit for 15 minutes so the flour hydrates and the flavor develops.

steps.title: Add veggies just before cooking
steps.step: Fold in cabbage, bean sprouts, and scallions so they stay crisp and don't release too much liquid.

steps.title: Heat the pan
steps.step: Place a large cast-iron skillet or nonstick pan over medium heat. Add 1 tbsp (15 ml) sesame oil and spread evenly.

steps.title: Cook the meat side first
steps.step: Lay a few slices of pork belly or bacon in the skillet. Once they start to turn opaque, spoon some batter over them to form a pancake ~15 cm across.

steps.title: Optional noodle layer
steps.step: If using noodles, spread about 70 g cooked noodles over the pancake before flipping.

substeps.title: Hiroshima-style
substeps.step: Use yakisoba noodles seasoned with Worcestershire sauce for authentic flavor.

steps.title: Flip & cook the second side
steps.step: Cook for about 4â€“5 minutes on the first side, then flip carefully.

steps.title: Optional egg-on-top method
steps.step: After flipping, crack a raw egg onto the center of the pancake. Cover with a lid and cook until the white is set but the yolk is still slightly runny (about 2â€“3 minutes).

substeps.title: Without egg
substeps.step: Simply cook until golden and crispy on both sides.

steps.title: Finish & serve
steps.step: Drizzle generously with okonomiyaki sauce and Kewpie mayo in a crisscross pattern. Sprinkle with aonori, bonito flakes, and scallions.

steps.title: Eat immediately
steps.step: Cut into quarters and serve hot.
